args: So that's where the auction will be held?
From the dark shadows of a back alley,\nthe prince fixes his gaze on a closed store.
I can't believe someone is actually going\nto put a dragon egg up for auction.\nWho would dare do such a thing?!
...Okay, where's Ranzal? If he doesn't\nshow soon, I might have to go in on my—
I take it you're also interested\nin this building here?
You're here for the egg as well?
Hey, hunting heretics is what I do.
As you know, dragons are sacred creatures\nto those of us in the Church.
Capturing them is an unforgivable sin,\nand selling their eggs is even worse.
That's why I was sent here.
You must have caught wind of the\nsame rumor I did.
Heh. You'd make a fine inquisitor.
Still, maybe it's not the best plan\nto just charge into this alone.
You're probably right. I just heard what\nwas happening and...lost it, I guess.
We're both after the same objective here,\nwhich means there's only one thing to do.
Work together and get the dragon\negg back?
Exactly! With your help, I know we'll\nbe able to storm any weathers!
(Heh. He stumbled over his words again,\nbut I'll pretend I didn't hear it. Let's go!)
Next, we have the highlight of the auction!
I risked both life and limb to secure this\nprize from deep beneath Mount Adolla.\nAllow me to present...an Ifrit egg!
You won't find another one of these on\nthe market again, so make your bids\nand make 'em big! Eeee hee hee hee!
Sorry to interrupt the fun, but I need\nall of you to put your hands up.
I'm Curran—an inquisitor with the Church.
And I'm pretty sure you aren't just a bunch\nof chefs looking for omelet ingredients.
An inquisitor?! Bah!\nYou'll never catch me!
Fools! You left the back door open!\nEeee hee hee hee!
Oh, darn, what EVER will I do!
Your suggestion to wait at the\nback exit was a good one, Curran.
I've seen more than my share of men like\nthis—they never know when to give up.
That's rich coming from a heretic like you!
Now I'm taking you lot back to\nthe Church with me.
...That's the last of them handed over.\nOur mission is done.
I'm glad we were able to stop them\nbefore the deal could proceed.
I can't believe they were actually trying\nto pass that thing off as an Ifrit egg.
It's just a cinder drake egg with some\nfancy patterns drawn on it!
Looks like they were hoping to deceive the\nbidders and make some fast money.

They should have seen right through it;
there's no way a low-life coward like that
has guts enough to enter the nest of a
ferocious dragon like Ifrit.
Still, a stolen egg is a stolen egg,\nand he'll pay dearly for this crime.
*sigh* What I wouldn't give for men like\nthat to vanish from this world for good.

They never think about the consequences
of their actions. I mean, if enough eggs
get stolen, the dragons would be furious—
and we'd all pay the price for that.
I don't think any of us want to imagine \nwhat disasters might unfold if they were\nto get truly angry with us.
Which is why I have to nip this stuff\nin the bud before it gets out of hand—\nas tedious as the work may be.
Well, what do you say to letting us\nhelp with that workload?
You want to help me? Are you serious?
I can't turn a blind eye if people are\nout there causing harm to dragons.
Well, my work doesn't JUST involve\ndragons, you know.
But I respect dragons in all that I do,\nso in that way, I suppose we are both\ntrying to achieve the same goal.

I'm not half the man the bishop is,
but I'm no bad guy, either—at least until
you're going against the Church's laws.
Anyway, glad to have your help.
